nodes.bodyText: If this is only used for testing, isn't it safer/better to move it to the testing code? You already have a method for adding tasks, all you need is a getter and then you can achieve the same, no?
I tried this, but it's hard to do it without breaking the synchronization guarantees. Though maybe you gave me another idea I'll try out.
Do we want these three cleanups to happen atomically, i.e all or nothing?
no, if one of them fails we should still try to clean the others
Why not use the actual value of heartbeat.interval.ms? Why hardcode it to 3 seconds?
it's a consumer config so it can be different for each consumer (and unfortunately this isn't a constant in the kafka code, so I can't just use a constant from that class directly)
